DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term (or description) that represents the anatomic site of organ enlargement.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus._The act of increasing (something) in size or volume or quantity or scope._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: AMC CRF:AIDS Malignancy Consortium Case Report Form

An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus._The act of increasing (something) in size or volume or quantity or scope._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time._Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that is part of the lymphatic system. The spleen produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys old blood cells. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach.

Concepts.definition: An organ that is part of the hematopoietic and immune systems. It is composed of the white pulp and the red pulp and is surrounded by a capsule. It is located in the left hypochondriac region. Its functions include lymphocyte production, blood cell storage, and blood cell destruction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium.  It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg.  Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions.  It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
